data.title: Novak Djokovic
data.meta_description: Read more about Novak Djokovic from The New Yorker
data.text:
The Sporting Scene

With Novak Djokovic, It Is Always a Struggle

In the U.S. Open final, against Daniil Medvedev, he battled and even seemed to tire before, as usual, emerging victorious.

The Sporting Scene

At Wimbledon, Carlos Alcaraz Defeated Novak Djokovic by Being Himself

In the most absorbing Grand Slam championship match on the men’s side in years, what mattered most was in-the-moment decision-making.

The Sporting Scene

Novak Djokovic Is Making His Own History Now

By winning the French Open again, he broke a tie with Rafael Nadal for the most career Grand Slam titles on the men’s side—and he isn’t done.

Replay

Novak Djokovic, the Hard-Court King, Conquers His Tenth Australian Open

Despite drama over a hamstring injury, a scandal regarding his father’s behavior, and criticism of his vaccination status, the Serbian great took home the men’s singles title.

The Sporting Scene

Roger Federer’s Generous Farewell

The game’s greatest player invited his supreme rival—and many others—to his final match.

The Sporting Scene

Roger Federer’s Beautiful Game

The great tennis champion, who has announced his retirement, got as close to the sport’s formal ideal as anyone ever has.

The Sporting Scene

Nick Kyrgios Does What He Wants. At Wimbledon, It Wasn’t Enough

The Australian tennis star played well, but still lost to Novak Djokovic in the final. Does he care?

The Sporting Scene

Djokovic’s Strange Australian Odyssey

The tennis champion’s resistance to the COVID-19 vaccine has brought about an international fiasco at the Australian Open.

Double Take

Sunday Reading: The Extraordinary Game of Tennis

From the magazine’s archive: a selection of pieces on the game and some of its most vivid personalities.

The Sporting Scene

Djokovic Finally Won the Crowd, but Daniil Medvedev Won the U.S. Open

Medvedev’s victory felt like tennis thrusting itself toward a future of fresh champions. It’s time.

The Sporting Scene

Novak Djokovic, French Open Winner and Likely the Best Ever

Along with Barbora Krejčíková, Djokovic was a singles champion in Paris this past weekend. He has now won nineteen majors, just one fewer than Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer.

The Sporting Scene

Rafael Nadal’s French Open Victory Over Novak Djokovic Extends Tennis’s Best Rivalry

Great competitors don’t always yield great matches, and Sunday’s contest was lopsided.

The Sporting Scene

Novak Djokovic Solves the Mind-Body Problem to Win the Australian Open

Is there any modern athlete who better reflects—and, in some strange way, seems to understand—the connection between the mind and the body?

The Sporting Scene

Novak Djokovic, a Spoiler and a Champion at Wimbledon

As Djokovic, the No. 1 player in the world, beat Roger Federer on Sunday, he wasn’t always at his best, but he was too flexible to break.

The Sporting Scene

Federer and Nadal’s Wimbledon Rematch Showed Just How Alike the Two Greats Have Become

The more they play, and the more they distance themselves from almost everyone else, the more they seem to share.

The Sporting Scene

Why Novak Djokovic Played a Doubles Match Hours After a Singles Upset

Top singles players don’t play doubles anymore, or not much, and certainly not immediately after losing in the third round of a tournament that they have won five times before.

The Sporting Scene

In the Australian Open Final, Novak Djokovic Cruises to a Lopsided Victory Over Rafael Nadal

The pair faced off for the fifty-third time, the most of any two players in the Open era, but Djokovic appeared to be the omniscient narrator of the match, defeating Nadal 6–3, 6–2, 6–3.

The Sporting Scene

At the U.S. Open, Novak Djokovic Isn’t the Most Beloved Player, But He Is the Best

In the three-hour final, there was no drama, really, just a creeping sense of inevitability. That’s how Djokovic accomplishes what he does.
